title: Simple Past Or Present Perfect Tense

questions.question: I’m sure we ……………………… before.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is more common with the time expressions ever, before, never, yet and already.

questions.question: I don’t believe in ghosts. At least, I …………………………. one yet.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is more common with the time expressions ever, before, never, yet and already.

questions.question: She ……………………….. never sought anyone’s help in her life.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is more common with the time expressions ever, before, never, yet and already.

questions.question: I ………………………… her once.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is common with the time expressions once.

questions.question: I …………………………….. to my parents about my plans.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is more common with the time expressions ever, before, never, yet and already.

questions.question: I ………………………………… the minister yesterday and he said he would help.
questions.description: We do not use the present perfect tense with definite past time expressions like yesterday.

questions.question: There ……………………………. an explosion at the castle last night.
questions.description: Last night is a definite past time expression and we do not use the present perfect tense with past time expressions.

questions.question: My grandparents …………………………….. a lot for me when they were alive.
questions.description: Here we are thinking about a past time and hence we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: How long ……………………………… married to him?
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense when we are thinking of a period of time continuing up to the present.

questions.question: He ……………………….. in
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to give somebody’s year or date of birth.

questions.question: I can’t go to the party because I ……………………………… my leg.
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense when we are thinking about past events together with their present results.

questions.question: Who ………………………………. you this mobile phone?
questions.description: We use the past tense when we identify the person responsible for a present situation.
